name: Dunskirk
culture_notes: tide-blessing rituals tied to fishing seasons
diet heavy on salted fish and kelp
nets and knot-work kept as family heirlooms
constraints: ritual magic consumes scarce imported reagents or specialized labor
no instant resurrection or true life-replacement magics; long-range mind influence rare and banned
navigational auguries aid but do not replace charts and seamanship
notes: small port at a river mouth with a prominent lighthouse-chapel
localized ritual workshops rely on imported reagents via the harbor
population small and partially transient (sailors, seasonal labor)
